sentence: I used to be indecisive... ...but now im not so sure.
explanation: sure can mean certain or reliable, or informal agreement.
first_new_sentence: Im sure that I will finish my homework tonight.
second_new_sentence: If youre sure about your decision, you should proceed with it.

sentence: Whats the difference between a pill and my penis? a pill can achieve an erection.
explanation: pill can refer to a medication, or slang for a woman in a derogatory context.
first_new_sentence: I take a pill every morning for my allergies.
second_new_sentence: The woman was described as a pill in a derogatory sense.

sentence: Why was kanyes christmas gift to kim spoiled? because hes a bad wrapper.
explanation: wrapper can mean someone who wraps a gift or packaging around an item.
first_new_sentence: The wrapper for the candy was colorful and eye-catching.
second_new_sentence: The wrapper hesitated as he finished wrapping the gift.

sentence: What do you call a cheap vasectomy? a rip off.
explanation: rip can mean to tear or damage, or to criticize someone harshly.
first_new_sentence: If you rip the paper too hard, it can tear.
second_new_sentence: To rip someone for their poor performance is unkind.

sentence: Why did the skeleton cross the road? to get to the body shop : )
explanation: body can refer to a physical human form or a collective of individuals.
first_new_sentence: The body of the athlete was examined by doctors for injuries.
second_new_sentence: She admired the body of work that the artist produced.

sentence: These entries satisfy the requirements of having the same word spelled identically with two different meanings within the context of the jokes.
